page.title: 04WILDLIFE NEAR BLAEN DYAR
page.content: Near Blaen Dyar there are lots of trees and birds as well as an occupied foxes den,it is near some old houses that have fallen down.There are lots of birds such as wood-pigeons,buzzards and other common birds.There are also trees and plants, some quite unusual. Down the Old Road, (which is near the school)there are lots of Beech trees and grey squirrels, some people have been known to see red squirrels but not very often. During the Spring we always have quite a lot of frogspawn as we have a quite a few ponds.Not many of the tadpoles survive as they do not have enough food.Sometimes we keep tadpoles in school.Butterflies are also common in the Summertime. Lots of our area is Moor-Land.
